project_abstract.cdata: The objective of the Sustainable Land and Water Management (SLWM) Additional Financing Project for Ghana is to expand the area under sustainable land and water management practices in selected watersheds. The additional financing will ensure the adoption of the sustainable land and water management practices aimed at reducing land degradation and enhancing maintenance of biodiversity in the Kulpawn-Sissili and Red Volta watersheds. The project will focus less on spatial planning at a large scale, with no additional financing towards it since the spatial planning activities are expected to be completed within the original timeframe. The original component structure remains the same. The structure of sub-components under component 2 is revised to reduce number of sub-components and simplify presentation. Component 2 originally included five sub-components which are now grouped into four sub-components for (i) systems, capacity and monitoring for SLWM; (ii) implementation of SLWM (sub-projects); (iii) national sustainable land management and Payment for Environmental Services monitoring; and (iv) management of biodiversity corridors.

keywords.cdata: sustainable use of biological diversity;Management of Natural Resources;sustainable land management;threats to biodiversity;global environmental objectives;carbon storage;terrestrial ecosystem;safeguard policy;Safeguard Policies;agricultural landscape;land degradation;Carbon sequestration;

project_abstract.cdata: The development objective of the Rio de Janeiro Sustainable Integrated Ecosystem Management in Productive Landscapes of the North-Northwestern Fluminise (GEF) Project for Brazil is to promote an integrated ecosystem management (IEM) approach to guide the development and implementation of sustainable land management (SLM) practices in the North and Northwest (NNWF) regions of Rio de Janeiro state. The changes derive from the findings of the final mid-term review report with regards to additional time required to fully achieve project objectives, and the need to reallocate grant proceeds among the different disbursement categories in line with anticipated project needs. The reallocation is necessary in order to reassign excess funds from the Incremental operating costs disbursement category and to assign the unallocated funds among the other four disbursement categories. There will be no changes in the percentage of financing for the different disbursement categories.

project_abstract.cdata: The objective of the Sustainable Cerrado Initiative is to enhance biodiversity conservation in, and to improve environmental and natural resource management of, the Cerrado in the Brazil's territory through appropriate policies and practices. This level two restructuring paper pertains to the extension of the closing date of two projects under this initiative: MMA (Ministry of Environment) Cerrado Policy and Biome Monitoring Project and the Tocantins Sustainable Cerrado Project. While the former project suffered delays due to the changes in MMA, which caused the project implementation to slow down, the latter projects implementation was delayed as some procurement processes took longer than expected to be completed. This necessitates extension of the time allotted for these projects. All other significant factors were deemed satisfactory and the projects are expected to reach their intended objectives.

P091827.projectinfo: <![CDATA[<Project><LangCode>ES</LangCode><ProjectAbstract>El proyecto de iniciativa sostenible de Cerrado para Brasil apoyará al Gobierno Federal y a los gobiernos estatales participantes en las siguientes áreas: a) conservación de la biodiversidad a través de la creación y consolidación de áreas protegidas y corredores ecológicos; b) implementación de la producción sostenible y gestión de la diversidad biológica de Cerrado; c) fortalecimiento y política institucionales y d) supervisión del bioma de Cerrado. Este documento de evaluación medioambiental (EA) determinó los siguientes efectos: desplazamiento de la población local; aumento de los problemas socioambientales entre las personas afectadas por el proyecto (PAP); explotación excesiva de las especies locales; desecho de residuos sólidos y contaminación del suelo y las fuentes de agua debido al uso excesivo de agroquímicos. Entre las medidas de mitigación se incluyen: desarrollar y hacer cumplir el manejo integrado de plagas (MIP); evitar o prohibir la eliminación sistemática de la vegetación mediante incendios forestales, el uso de maquinaria pesada que dañará la estructura del suelo y el uso de agua contaminada debido a la presencia de agroquímicos, fertilizantes y residuos industriales; y, finalmente, a lo largo del diseño e implementación del proyecto, adherirse a las disposiciones medioambientales y sociales legales y reguladoras incluidas en la legislatura de los Estados participantes de Goiás, Tocantins y el distrito federal, y las directivas operacionales de salvaguardia del Banco Mundial sobre: evaluación medioambiental (OP 4.01), hábitats naturales (OP 4.04) y gestión de plagas (OP 4.09).</ProjectAbstract></Project><Project><LangCode>FR</LangCode><ProjectAbstract>Le Sustainable Cerrado Initiative Project for Brazil (Projet d’initiative durable de Cerrado au Brésil) vise à aider le gouvernement fédéral et les gouvernements des États participants dans les domaines suivants : a) préservation de la biodiversité en créant et consolidant des zones protégées et des corridors écologiques ; b) mise en œuvre de production et de gestion durables de la diversité biologique de Cerrado ; c) renforcement des institutions et des politiques ; et d) suivi du biome de Cerrado. Ce document d’évaluation environnementale a évalué les impacts de ce projet qui sont les suivants : déplacement de la population locale ; augmentation des problèmes sociaux et environnementaux chez les personnes touchées par le projet ; exploitation excessive des espèces locales ; rejet de déchets solides ; et contamination des sols et des sources d’eau attribuable à une utilisation excessive de produits agrochimiques. Les mesures d’atténuation proposées comprennent : élaborer et mettre en œuvre un plan de gestion des organismes nuisibles (manejo integrado de plagas ou MIP) ; éviter ou intedire l’utilisation systématique de défrichement de la végétation par le feu, l’utilisation de machinerie lourde qui endommagera la structure du sol, l’utilisation d’eaux contaminées par des produits agrochimiques, des engrais et des résidus industriels ; et, enfin, respecter tout au long de la conception et de la mise en œuvre du projet les dispositions juridiques et réglementaires sociales et environnementales contenues dans les lois des États participants de Goais, Tocantins et du district fédéral ainsi que les directives opérationnelles de sauvegarde de la Banque mondiale relatives à : l’évaluation environnementale (OP 4.01), les habitats naturels (OP 4.04), et la gestion des organismes nuisibles (OP 4.09).</ProjectAbstract></Project>]]>

keywords.cdata: Sustainable Transport and Air Quality;economic and financial analysis;freight management;road safety study;adaptable program loan;decrease in emissions;Urban Transport Planning;investment in road;mode of transport;Public Transport;land use;extension period;Public Transportation;public transportation mode;transport mode;

project_abstract.cdata: The objectives of the Sustainable Transport and Air Quality Project for Mexico are to assist the selected municipalities to: 1) reduce Green House Gases (GHG) emissions growth rates by fostering long term increases in the use of less energy intensive transport modes, and (2) induce policy changes in favor of sustainable transport projects. This paper pertains to a restructuring of the grant agreement for the project. The changes during this restructuring are: i) a change in the executing agency for purposes of the grant, ii) the extension of the closing date to December 31, 2014, and iii) a reallocation of funds between disbursement categories, from operating cost and training, to consultant services. It is felt that a change in the executing agency is warranted due to the appropriateness of the new agency in the context of project implementation. The extension in the loan closing date is to allow the executing agency to reach the project targets, after facing delays in project implementation. The reallocation is deemed necessary as the agency does not require the remaining funds to cover the operating costs of the project coordinating unit in the operating cost and training category. The funds instead better serve the consultant services category.

P114012.projectinfo: <![CDATA[<Project><LangCode>ES</LangCode><ProjectAbstract>El objetivo del Proyecto de Transformación del Transporte Urbano (PTTU) es contribuir a la transformación del transporte urbano en las ciudades mexicanas para reducir el crecimiento de las emisiones de carbono mejorando la calidad y sostenibilidad de los sistemas y servicios de transporte público urbano. Eso reducirá marcadamente la huella de carbono y la toxicidad del aire generada por el sector del transporte. Las siguientes son algunas de las medidas negativas: gestión de materiales y residuos; restricción de los flujos de tránsito y del acceso a las viviendas y las empresas; aumento del ruido y de la emisión de contaminantes; gestión de sitios de obras, e interferencia con infraestructura urbana (líneas telefónicas, cañerías, cables eléctricos y cloacas). Algunas medidas de mitigación: se espera que el PTTU tenga impactos ambientales positivos a largo plazo, ya que apunta a mejorar la calidad de los sistemas de transporte público y de transporte no motorizado, así como el flujo y la seguridad del tránsito. El programa está diseñado para tener un impacto positivo a largo plazo gracias a la reducción de emisiones generales y locales, por ejemplo, de CO2, NOx, SOx, material particulado y otros contaminantes actualmente presentes. La reducción se relacionará directamente con una mejor operación de vehículos, distancias de viaje más cortas, el uso de modos más eficientes de transporte y tecnologías mejoradas.</ProjectAbstract></Project>]]>

project_abstract.cdata: The objective of the Forest Conservation and Sustainability in the Heart of the Colombian Amazon Project for Colombia is to improve governance and promote sustainable land use activities in order to reduce deforestation and conserve biodiversity in the project area. The project has four components. (1) Protected areas management and financial sustainability component will: (a) strengthen the management effectiveness of the Natural Chiribiquete Mountain Ridge National Park (PNNSCH) and its buffer zone through inter alia, the design and implementation of a management plan for the PNNSCH; and (b) increase the financial sustainability of about 2.7 million hectares of PAs within the PNNSCH and its buffer zone. (2) Forest governance, management, and monitoring component seeks to: (a) enhance the institutional capacity and financial sustainability for sustainable landscape governance, management, and monitoring; (b) enhance the institutional capacity to monitor greenhouse gas (GHG) emission reductions; (c) enhance the capacity of indigenous peoples authorities for sustainable land-use practices and forest governance within indigenous territories; and (d) support the disclosure of data on reduction of deforestation. (3) Sectoral programs for sustainable landscape management component seeks to: (a) support improvement of crosssectoral policy coordination and consistency to achieve long-term reductions in deforestation; (b) support the development and adoption of guidelines and programs in, inter alia, the agriculture, extractive industries and infrastructure sectors, aimed at reducing pressures on forests and biodiversity, and GHG emissions and restoring ecosystems; (c) support the promotion of sustainable land-use and natural resource management practices that contribute to the restoration of vegetation, reduce pressure on forests and advance the livelihoods of local communi

project_abstract.cdata: This development policy loan (DPL) is the first operation in a series of two loans which span the period 2008-2010 and aim to support the Government of Brazi (GoB) efforts to (i) improve the effectiveness and efficiency of policies and guidelines of the Brazilian environmental management system; and (ii) further integrate principles of environmentally sustainable development in the development agenda of key sectors. By focusing on these sectors, the Sustainable Environmental Management (SEM) DPL series will support the GoB commitment to implement a model of accelerated competitiveness and growth while assuring improved environmental and poverty outcomes, which are pillars of the 2008-2011 Country Partnership Strategy (CPS). In this way, the SEM DPL series supports the GoB concerted efforts to promote the sustainable management of agricultural lands, forests, and water resources; reduction of deforestation in the Amazon; reduction of the environmental degradation of land, water, and other resources which are key determinants of the well-being of the poor; and promotion of renewable.

P095205.projectinfo: <![CDATA[<Project><LangCode>ES</LangCode><ProjectName>Primer préstamo programático de políticas de desarrollo para la gestión ambiental sostenible</ProjectName><ProjectAbstract>Este préstamo para políticas de desarrollo es la primera operación de una serie de dos préstamos para el período 2008-2010 y tiene como objetivo respaldar los esfuerzos del Gobierno de Brasil por i) mejorar la eficacia y eficiencia de las políticas y las directrices del sistema de gestión ambiental brasileño, y ii) integrar en mayor medida los principios de desarrollo sostenible desde el punto de vista ambiental en las actividades relacionadas con el desarrollo que llevan adelante sectores clave. Al centrarse en estos sectores, la serie de préstamos para políticas de desarrollo en materia de gestión ambiental sostenible respaldará el compromiso del Gobierno de Brasil con un modelo de competitividad y crecimiento acelerados, al tiempo que garantizará unos mejores resultados en materia ambiental y de pobreza, que son los pilares de la Estrategia de Alianza con el País 2008-2011. Así pues, esta serie de préstamos respalda los esfuerzos concertados del Gobierno de Brasil por promover la gestión sostenible de tierras agrícolas, bosques y recursos hídricos; la reducción de la deforestación en la Amazonia; la disminución del deterioro ambiental de la tierra, el agua y otros recursos que son determinantes clave del bienestar de los pobres, y la promoción de la energía renovable.</ProjectAbstract></Project>]]>

project_abstract.cdata: The development objective of the Promoting Sustainable Community Based Natural Resource Management and Institutional Development Project for Indonesia is to strengthen institutional and local capacity for decentralized forest management and generate improved forest-based livelihoods in targeted areas. This project has four components. 1) The first component, Strengthening Legislation, Policy, and Institutional Capacity in Decentralized Forest Management, will build on existing efforts to harmonize regulations and the work of Sekretariat Nasional Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (SEKNAS, KPH National Secretariat) to increase support for operationalizing Kesatuan Pengelolaan Hutan (KPHs, Forest Management Unit)). It has two subcomponents as follows: (i) Forest policy and legislation development, revision and amendment; and (ii) Institutional development and capacity building. 2) The second component, Developing the Knowledge Platform, will address the needs by establishing an effective modern knowledge platform that facilitates information and data sharing, access and use of user friendly outputs, and knowledge exchange among practitioners. It has two subcomponents as follows: (i) Knowledge Management and Information System; and (ii) Capacity-building and knowledge exchange. 3) The third component, Improving Forest Management Practices, supports up to 10 KPH facing challenges in becoming operational, specifically with respect to institutional capacity, supporting communities, and sustainable utilization of forest products (timber and non-timber). It has three subcomponents as follows: (i) Advance KPH operationalization; (ii) Community empowerment in up to 10 KPH areas; and (iii) KPH-based knowledge exchange centers. 4) The fourth component, Project Management, Monitoring and Reporting, and Program Coordination, will support project management and oversight, and implementati

project_abstract.cdata: The Mexico Second Programmatic Environment Development Policy Loan Project will support the second stage of the government's medium-term, outcome-based program to promote sustainable development. The overarching objective of the program is to balance socio-economic development with environmental protection and improvement. The program will focus on: (1) mainstreaming environmental concerns in the development agendas o f key sectors-- tourism, energy, forestry and water--as prioritized by the Government of Mexico (GOM); and (2) improving the effectiveness and efficiency of local environmental management processes in Mexico.
